intro: Miconia wurdackii, commonly known as the Wurdack miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves and showy, clustered pink to purple flowers. It is often found in humid lowland forests and can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
